intro: Goniothalamus kamarudinii, commonly known as the Kamarudin's talaud, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as an evergreen tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
